snippet: Airlines in the region are expected to generate profits of $2 billion this year, far more than those of any other region, and new airlines are popping up at a faster pace than ever before.
abstract: International Air Transport Association says airlines in the Asia-Pacific region are expected to generate profits of $2 billion in 2012, two-thirds of total industry profit and far more than those of any other region; new airlines are popping up at a faster pace than ever before.
lead_paragraph: Airlines in the region are expected to generate profits of $2 billion this year, far more than those of any other region, and new airlines are popping up at a faster pace than ever before.

headline.seo: Low-Cost Airlines Open at Fast Clip in Asia-Pacific Region
headline.main: Asia-Pacific Region Is Fertile Ground for Low-Cost Airlines
headline.print_headline: In Asia-Pacific Region, New Low-Cost Airlines Are Opening Rapidly

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
